results.title: How television works
results.creator_credit: Colin Bell, Frank Wells, Gaumont-British Instructional and J. Arthur Rank Organisation
results.brief_description: An explanation of the basic principles of television, including the principles of the television camera in photography and in broadcasting images. Illustrates how the lens puts the picture on to the end of a special vacuum tube, how the picture is changed into electrical impulses and how electron beams spray the mosaic. The transmitting aerial and family scenes before the home television set complete the cycle of transmission.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colin Bell, Frank Wells, Gaumont-British Instructional and J. Arthur Rank Organisation

results.title: How talkies talk
results.brief_description: How the microphone picks up sound in the film studio; how the electrical impulses are transmitted to the recording room and amplified, how sound is photographed on to a special track, how a married print is made, and how sound works when projected in a cinema.

results.title: How safe is surgery?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Surgeons today perform operations which would have seemed miraculous only a few years ago; but even now, a century after Joseph Lister published the first accounts of his revolutionary technique of antiseptic surgery, infection after operations is a menace, probably costing the Health Service six million pounds a year. Investigates both the techniques used to prevent infection during an actual operation and research into the causes of infection which still trouble British hospitals. Reporter: Christopher Chataway.

results.title: How precise is precise
results.creator_credit: Rodney Musch, Philip Law and Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production
results.brief_description: The Hobart Science Centre specialises in the production of some intricate instruments which are used in various industries and laboratories in Australia and overseas. Describes some of the activities and processes conducted by the centre.

results.title: How plants help us: observing things around us
results.brief_description: A young boy bicycling to his uncle’s farm observes the plants around him and discovers that plants are helpful in many ways. Explains that people are dependent upon plants for food, clothing, wood, paper, rubber and many other common articles important in their daily lives.

results.title: How plants feed
results.brief_description: A study of how plants obtain the elements necessary for their existence from the air and from the soil. Microcinematography and animation are used to show how, through their roots and leaves, plants absorb nourishment from the air and the soil, and how crystals are formed in the plant cells from concentrated solutions of certian substances.

results.title: How pine trees reproduce
results.creator_credit: William M. Harlow and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Uses time lapse and close-up photography to study the processes involved in the reproduction of pine trees - the opening mechanism of pine cones, the fertilization of seed-producing cones by wind-borne pollen from male cones, the dissemination of seeds, and the germination of seeds. Stresses the importance of continuing research to conserve and improve the quality of the pine forests of North America.
results.creator_credit_for_label: William M. Harlow and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: How much is enough
results.creator_credit: Bill Latto and Town and Country Productions
results.brief_description: Deals with the work of the United Nations Children’s Fund in Africa, the Near East, Pakistan, the Orient and the West Indies. It shows the scope and the type of work done by the organisation which raises money all over the world to help needy children in underdeveloped areas

results.title: How much cooperation?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Office Supervisor’s Problems”.
A discussion-provoking film about employer and employee office cooperation. A supervisor returns from an out of town trip with a rush job. He speaks to the staff about it and promises to have it ready so they won’t have to work back on it.

results.title: How much affection?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marriage and Family Living”.
A social guidance docu-drama promoting restraint against premarital sex. After nearly succumbing to her boyfriend’s advances, teenager Laurie seeks her mother’s advice. Following a sensible discussion with her mother and the lesson provided by her friend Eileen, a victim of her physical urges, Laurie considers the long term consequences of sexual temptation.
